concept.title: Admission into the Major
concept.shortdesc: Before a student can take upper level ISyE classes, they must be admitted into the major. This guide is framed around students, typically sophomores, who need help declaring their major as ISyE.

ol.li: Print the student's current Academic Process Audit Summary (APAS) report.
From the APAS report, verify which entry level ISyE required courses have been completed.

Mark off the student's completed courses on the ISyE four-year sample program. This guide will provide students with an easy-to-read planning tool to determine which classes to prioritize for admission acceptance.
Review the ISyE four-year sample program with the student to map out an admission to the major plan.

Summarize notes from the meeting, which can include:
A course plan
Internship search plan
Referrals
Extenuating circumstances regarding a student's academic situation
Log the meeting notes into APLUS.
If there are any follow-up communications, either schedule or perform them.

row.entry: What qualities make a good ISyE major candidate?
A student should have a strong interest in analytical thinking, business applications, and a strong mathematical and statistics background.
What admission requirements must be met to be accepted into the ISyE major?

A student must have a 2.0 GPA in the following technical courses:
PHYS 1302W—Intro to Physics II
CHEM 1065—Chem Principles I Lab
CHEM 1065—Chem Prinicples I
MATH 2374—Multivariable Calculus
IE 1101—Foundations of ISyE
IE 2021—Engineering Econ
What is the date range for students to apply?
The major application period opens each year on October 1 and closes December 30.
